articles.author: Samia Nakhoul
articles.title: U.S. killing of Iran's second most powerful man risks regional conflagration
articles.description: The U.S. killing of Qassem Soleimani, Iran's most powerful figure after its supreme leader, is seen by Tehran as an act of war that risks regional conflagration.'
articles.content:
BEIRUT (Reuters) - The U.S. killing of Qassem Soleimani, Iran’s most powerful figure after its supreme leader, is seen by Tehran as an act of war that risks regional conflagration. 
By ordering Friday’s air strike on the commander of the Iranian Revolutionar… [+5383 chars]

articles.author: Michelle Sierra
articles.title: US syndicated loan issuance tumbles as confidence drops
articles.description: NEW YORK, Jan 3 (LPC) - Trade wars, uncertainty about Brexit and a potential looming recession reduced US syndicated lending to US$2.11trn, an abysmal 20% drop from the prior record-year tally.
articles.content:
NEW YORK, Jan 3 (LPC) - Trade wars, uncertainty about Brexit and a potential looming recession reduced US syndicated lending to US$2.11trn, an abysmal 20% drop from the prior record-year tally.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Polish bird flu outbreak spreads, with four more cases
articles.description: Four more outbreaks of bird flu have been reported across Poland, authorities said on Friday, bringing the total number of incidents in Europe's largest poultry producer to six this week.
articles.content:
WARSAW (Reuters) - Four more outbreaks of bird flu have been reported across Poland, authorities said on Friday, bringing the total number of incidents in Europe’s largest poultry producer to six this week.

articles.author: Rich McKay
articles.title: Methodist church plans to split over gay marriage, clergy: church officials
articles.description: The United Methodist Church plans to split into two denominations later this year, church officials said on Friday, a schism that follows years of contention over whether the church should end its ban on gay marriage and ordination of gay clergy.

articles.author: Diego Oré
articles.title: Mexico president calls for Julian Assange to be released from UK prison
articles.description: Mexico's President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday called for Wikileaks founder Julian Assange to be released from prison in London, urging an end to what he described as his "torture" in detention.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico’s President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador on Friday called for Wikileaks founder Julian Assange to be released from prison in London, urging an end to what he described as his “torture” in detention.

articles.title: Iraqi parliament to hold extraordinary session on Sunday -statement
articles.description: Iraq's parliament will hold an extraordinary session on Sunday to discuss the U.S. air strike in Baghdad which killed Iran's Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis, it said on Friday.
articles.content:
BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iraq’s parliament will hold an extraordinary session on Sunday to discuss the U.S. air strike in Baghdad which killed Iran’s Quds Force leader Qassem Soleimani and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis, it said on Friday.

articles.title: Mexico to keep importing natural gas as U.S. exporters face oversupply
articles.description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador said on Friday it will be a long time before Mexico produces enough natural gas to become self-sufficient and the country will continue to rely on imports until then, a boon for U.S. exporters.
